articles.title: Kim Jong Un Sends Autographs after Reading Letters from Officials, Working People and Schoolchildren
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un Sends Autographs after Reading Letters from Officials, Working People and Schoolchildren
Pyongyang, April 1 (KCNA) -- The dear respected Kim Jong Un on March 28 sent autographs after reading letters presented by officials and other working people of various units and schoolchildren. 
					Kim Jong Un received letters from the employees of the Sangwon Cement Complex and the Pyongyang Maternity Hospital, the journalists and editors of the Art and Literature Publishing House, the first commanding officers of the Kamnamu (persimmon tree) Company, the participants in the ceremony for completing Sinhung Restaurant which was rebuilt on an expansion basis and the first winners of the Kim Jong Il Children Honor Prize in North Hamgyong Province.
					
					In their letters they expressed ardent yearning and boundless reverence for President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il in the run-up to the Day of the Sun.
					
					They expressed their strong will to remain intensely loyal to Kim Jong Un. 
					
					They also wholeheartedly wished Kim Jong Un good health for the prosperity of the great Kim Il Sung's nation and Kim Jong Il's Korea and the happiness of the generations to come.

articles.title: Ro Su Hui Tours Various Parts of DPRK
articles.content:
Ro Su Hui Tours Various Parts of DPRK
Pyongyang, April 1 (KCNA) -- Ro Su Hui, vice-chairman of the South Headquarters of the Pan-national Alliance for Korea's Reunification, toured the area of Mt. Myohyang on Saturday and Sunday.
					At the International Friendship Exhibition House he viewed a large number of gifts presented to President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il by party and state leaders of different countries and world famous figures.
					
					Exploring the Chonthaedong area, he viewed the fantastic scenery of Mt. Myohyang, a combination of exquisite and magnificent beauties.
					
					He looked round historic sites including Taeung Hall, Manse Pavilion and Kwanum Hall at Pohyon Temple.
					
					Earlier, he visited the Hana Musical Information Center, the Korean Central History Museum and other places.

articles.title: Letter to Kim Jong Un from Participants in Seminar of World Political Parties
articles.content:
Letter to Kim Jong Un from Participants in Seminar of World Political Parties
Pyongyang, April 1 (KCNA) -- The dear respected Kim Jong Un received a letter sent by Alberto Anaya Gutierrez, coordinator of the National Coordinating Committee of the Workers' Party of Mexico, on March 24 on behalf of the participants in the 16th Seminar of World Political Parties on Building a New Society held in Mexico.
					The participants in the seminar mourned for the demise of leader Kim Jong Il, the great sage and steadfast anti-imperialist fighter respected by the world, the letter said.
					
					Kim Jong Il, who made an undying contribution to accomplishing the human cause of independence through his outstanding ideological and theoretical activities and with his unique Songun politics, will be alive in the hearts of all the participants, it noted.
					
					The Workers' Party of Korea and the Korean people are now pushing forward the building of a thriving socialist nation despite the vicious blockade of the imperialists, it said, adding this is instilling confidence in victory into the world progressive political parties and peoples struggling for socialism against imperialism.
					
					The letter expressed belief that the WPK and the Korean people would usher in a great heyday of prosperity in 2012 marking the centenary of the birth of President Kim Il Sung under the wise leadership of Kim Jong Un.

articles.title: Int'l Festival Commemorating Centenary of Birth of Kim Il Sung to Be Held
articles.content:
Int'l Festival Commemorating Centenary of Birth of Kim Il Sung to Be Held
Pyongyang, April 1 (KCNA) -- An international festival commemorating the centenary of the birth of President Kim Il Sung will take place in Mt. Paektu and Pyongyang from April 11 to 16.
					It will be co-sponsored by the international preparatory committee and the DPRK preparatory committee for commemorating the centenary of the birth of Kim Il Sung. 
					
					During the festival colorful events will be held. Among them are visit to the President's old home at Mangyongdae and planting of trees there, visit to the old home of leader Kim Jong Il in the Paektusan secret camp, an international joint meeting for commemorating the centenary of the birth of the President, an exhibition of books on the greatness of the three commanders of Mt. Paektu and literary works revering them and an awarding ceremony of an international prize contest of literary works. 
					
					It will bring together hundreds of foreign delegates including representatives of the international preparatory committee, regional and different national preparatory committees, those who had the honor of being received by Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il and their descendants, world famous personages, members of organizations for friendship and solidarity with the Korean people and international bodies.

articles.title: Global Trend of Developing Space for Peaceful Purposes
articles.content:
Global Trend of Developing Space for Peaceful Purposes
Pyongyang, April 1 (KCNA) -- All nations are dynamically pushing forward the work to use outer space for peaceful purposes because this has become a tendency.
					The ongoing global development of space is characterized by multi-polarization, full-scale competition. 
					
					Several countries launched satellites and other space vehicles for communications, meteorological observation and other peaceful purposes in a recent one year.
					
					In this period, China sent about 20 satellites into space for different purposes.
					
					It set a goal of launching 30 satellites in total this year.
					
					A spokesperson for the Russian Space Industry Complex said on Dec. 8 last year that 24 satellites for different purposes are involved in the Glonas-system orbit group at present.
					
					India launched a communication satellite in last July and 4 satellites in last October while Iran put another domestically-manufactured satellite into orbit in February this year.
					
					Nigeria blasted off 2 earth observation satellites in last August and a communication satellite in last December.
					
					Argentina fired a rocket in last July.
					
					What is noteworthy is that cooperation and assistance are being boosted among states in manufacturing and launching satellites in line with the daily growing trend of internationalization and universalization of the space development.
					
					Pakistan used a Chinese carrier rocket to launch its communication satellite while Russia's carrier rocket sent into space communication satellites of Kazakhstan, Mexico and the Netherlands.
					
					Poland's first satellite used a European carrier rocket to be put into orbit.
					
					Amid the active global competition for developing outer space, many countries have worked out forward-looking space policies and development plans to suit their specific conditions and foundations are setting about conquering space.

articles.title: New Poster Celebrating 80th KPA Birthday Produced
articles.content:
New Poster Celebrating 80th KPA Birthday Produced
Pyongyang, April 1 (KCNA) -- A new poster for celebrating the 80th anniversary of the Korean People's Army (KPA) was produced in the DPRK. 
					The poster depicts the flying colors of the KPA against the background of cheerful display of fireworks in the nocturnal sky. It carries letters reading "Celebration of the 80th anniversary of the heroic Korean People's Army". 
					
					It deals with the glorious 80-year long history of the KPA which has won victories under the leadership of Generalissimos Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il and the firm pledge of all the service personnel and people of the DPRK to accomplish the cause of the Juche revolution started in Mt. Paektu.

articles.title: S. Korean Authorities Denounced for Disturbing Int'l Tour of Mt. Kumgang
articles.content:
S. Korean Authorities Denounced for Disturbing Int'l Tour of Mt. Kumgang
Pyongyang, April 1 (KCNA) -- A spokesman for the Guidance Bureau of the Special Zone for International Tour of Mt. Kumgang of the DPRK made public the following statement on Sunday:
					The international tour of Mt. Kumgang is making brisk headway amid great public interest at home and abroad. 
					
					Many foreign tourists and tour companies are expressing their will to take an active part in the international tour of Mt. Kumgang. They are making applications for tour, proposing tour contracts, operation of tour facilities and investment, etc. 
					
					The relevant units of the DPRK are successfully making every preparation for entry and departure procedures for tourists, transportation and provision of every convenience. 
					
					Much upset by big progress made in the international tour of Mt. Kumgang, the Lee Myung Bak regime of south Korea is making desperate efforts to disturb the tour. 
					
					According to information disclosed, the Lee group issued a secret order to the missions of south Korea in third countries to employ every means and method to block the tour of Mt. Kumgang to be arranged on the occasion of the Day of the Sun. 
					
					Pursuant to this order, the south Korean missions sent official notices to the governments and authorities concerned and tour agencies in the relevant countries and regions, asking them not to send tourists to Mt. Kumgang, claiming that it is "illegal" to do so and "personal safety cannot be guaranteed." Those concerned and field agents of the Ministry of Unification, Ministry of Foreign Affairs and Trade, the Intelligence Service, the Ministry of Defense and others of south Korea are busy with conducting diplomacy and hatching all sorts of despicable plots and carrying out lobbying operations to scuttle the tour. 
					
					The Lee group is wooing tour companies of south Korea into bribing foreign shipping companies in a bid to cancel contracts on chartering passenger boats for tour of Mt. Kumgang. And when those companies refuse to meet its requests, the group is threatening that it would make them go to ruin. 
					
					The puppet group went the lengths of threatening overseas compatriots active for international tour of Mt. Kumgang in every way and hatching even a sinister plot to abduct them by stealth. 
					
					The above-said despicable operations of the Lee group are another grave provocation against the DPRK as they are aimed at chilling the atmosphere of commemorating the auspicious Day of the Sun this year, the centenary of the birth of President Kim Il Sung, tarnish the image of the DPRK, making their bankrupt obstructive steps workable and escalating the confrontation with fellow countrymen in the north. 
					
					As far as the tourist incident and the issue of personal safety touted by the Lee group are concerned, they are nothing but far-fetched assertions to block the tour of Mt. Kumgang as their truth has already been brought to light. 
					
					The issues of monopoly over the tour of Mt. Kumgang and the right to properties were also clarified by the DPRK after instituting a new law to cope with the south Korean conservative authorities' unilateral suspension of the tour of Mt. Kumgang for years and their step to block south Korean companies from entering the area of Mt. Kumgang. 
					
					According to the regulations of the new law, the south Korean business was deprived of the monopoly over the tour of Mt. Kumgang and the right to properties is fully guaranteed to everyone. The properties of enterprises of south Korea no longer remain controversial as the work has already begun to dispose of them by law according to relevant procedures. 
					
					All kinds of special privileges and conveniences in the above-said zone are ensured by the law of the Special Zone for International Tour of Mt. Kumgang. 
					
					That is why, the number of tour businessmen and tourists willing to take part in the tour has rapidly increased as the days go by since the promulgation of the law. 
					
					International tour of Mt. Kumgang was successfully arranged on a trial basis by ships and planes several times last year amid the keen interest of the public at home and abroad. 
					
					This being a hard reality, the Lee group is foolish enough to block the tour with sheer sophism. This only brings to light their true colors as confrontation maniacs. 
					
					Not content with barring south Koreans from touring Mt. Kumgang, the Lee group is resorting even to such mean and sinister plot to disturb even the international tour, an unpardonable crime. This is, indeed, shame on the nation and the group is the enemy of civilization and the root cause of all evils. 
					
					With no desperate effort can the group escape failure in its operations to disturb the tour. It is bound to meet a miserable end, cursed by the nation and censured by the world people. 
					
					The world famous Mt. Kumgang is not only the pride of the Korean nation but also cultural heritage common to mankind. 
					
					Mt. Kumgang, a superb scenic beauty, is fully open to all tourists in the blooming best tour season of April. 
					
					The Guidance Bureau of the Special Zone for International Tour of Mt. Kumgang welcomes all the tourists coming to Mt. Kumgang and will make every possible sincere effort to let them spend pleasant days in the best scenic spot.

articles.title: S. Korean Authorities Urged to Give up Its Attempt to Escalate Confrontation of Social Systems
articles.content:
S. Korean Authorities Urged to Give up Its Attempt to Escalate Confrontation of Social Systems
Pyongyang, April 1 (KCNA) -- The south Korean conservative forces have recently spread a false story about social system instability in the DPRK in a bid to distort the situation of the dignified DPRK, a campaign to mislead public opinion. This is a revelation of their sinister intention to tarnish the image of the dignified system in the DPRK, divert elsewhere public criticism of them and bridge over the most serious ruling crisis.
					Rodong Sinmun Sunday says this in a bylined article. 
					
					Noting that the army and people of the DPRK united closer around the headquarters of the revolution have fully demonstrated the invincibility and solidness of the Korean style socialist system, the article goes on:
					
					The whole world was struck with admiration at the single-minded unity of the DPRK and its harmonious whole, something others can hardly imagine, and they stunned the forces hostile to the DPRK.
					
					The Lee Myung Bak group's reckless action is no more than a poor farce staged by it to comfort itself, taken aback by the might of the DPRK. 
					
					"Instability of social system" is being created in south Korea where the serious political tsunami and economic bankruptcy were caused by the unpopular policy of the Lee group and, consequently, people's anti-"government" actions are mounting. The situation goes to prove that the ruin of the Lee group is drawing near to be a reality. 
					
					Such rubbish as "period of transition" and "instability of social system" can never work in the DPRK dynamically advancing thanks to the steadfast succession to the cause of Songun revolution.

articles.title: S. Korean Organizations Condemn Warmongers for Staging Large-scale Joint Landing Drills
articles.content:
S. Korean Organizations Condemn Large-scale Joint Landing Drill
Pyongyang, April 1 (KCNA) -- South Korean civic and social organizations including the People for Achieving Peace and Reunification, the south Korean Confederation of Trade Unions and the Solidarity for Progress on March 29 made public a statement condemning the U.S. imperialists and south Korean warmongers for staging a large-scale joint landing drill under the simulated conditions of invasion of the north.
					The statement said U.S. and south Korean marine forces staged the drill that day.
					
					The exercise staged with nearly ten thousand troops involved as part of "Ssangyong" drill was the largest-ever in 23 years, it said.
					
					The military said the drill was aimed at "containing the north and demonstrating the firm alliance with the U.S.", openly disclosing the aggressive and offensive nature of the drill against the north.
					
					The statement demanded the U.S. and the south Korean authorities immediately halt acts to escalate the military tension and trouble on the Korean Peninsula.

articles.title: S. Korean Workers Declare Actions for Wage Increase
articles.content:
S. Korean Workers Declare Actions for Wage Increase
Pyongyang, April 1 (KCNA) -- The south Korean Confederation of Trade Unions (KCTU) held a meeting for declaring actions for wage increase in Seoul on March 28. 
					Speakers at the meeting said that workers had no option but to turn out in actions again as they cannot maintain their existence no matter how hard they work. 
					
					The south Korean "government" lends deaf ear to the demand of the workers for wage increase, while pouring tens of billions of won into the "nuclear security summit", they said, adding that this can be solved only through actions. 
					
					The participants expressed the will to surely punish the "government" authorities for enforcing an unpopular policy, chanting the slogan "Let us change society through a general strike of the KCTU!"

articles.title: Koreans in Uzbekistan Commemorate Kim Il Sung's Birth Anniversary
articles.content:
Koreans in Uzbekistan Commemorate Kim Il Sung's Birth Anniversary
Pyongyang, April 1 (KCNA) -- A Korean art festival took place in Tashkent on Mar. 26 in the run-up to the centenary of the birth of President Kim Il Sung.
					Present there were officials of the organizations of Koreans in Uzbekistan, Korean residents, members of more than 20 Korean art organizations, the charge d'affaires ad interim of the DPRK in Uzbekistan and staff members of the DPRK embassy.
					
					Ju Yong Il, chairman of the Elders Association for Korean Cultural Tradition, in his speech said that the festival this year is more significant as it is under way to commemorate the centenary of the birth of the President.
					
					The revolutionary cause of the President has made triumphant advance thanks to leader Kim Jong Il, he noted. 
					
					Rosy is the future of the DPRK as long as it is under the leadership of the dear respected Kim Jong Un, identical to Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il, he added. 
					
					He called on compatriots to advance more dynamically to achieve national reunification, the life-long desire of the peerlessly great persons.
					
					Put on the stage were chorus "Song of General Kim Il Sung", the immortal revolutionary hymn, "Where Are You, Dear General?" a famous masterpiece, and other songs and dances.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung's Birth Anniversary Commemorated in Different Countries
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung's Birth Anniversary Commemorated in Different Countries
Pyongyang, April 1 (KCNA) -- Meetings, seminars and photo exhibitions took place in Cuba, Romania, Colombia, Egypt and Uganda between March 23 and 26 to commemorate the centenary of the birth of President Kim Il Sung.
					On display in their venues were photos on the undying revolutionary career and feats of Kim Il Sung and photos on the achievements made by the army and people of the DPRK in socialist construction.
					
					Juan Jose Leon Vega, chairman of the Cuban Preparatory Committee for Commemorating the Centenary of the Birth of President Kim Il Sung, said that the President liberated Korea through an armed struggle and led the Fatherland Liberation War to victory, starting the U.S. imperialists on the downhill and turning the DPRK into a socialist land of bliss in a short period.
					
					Constantin Rotaru, chairman of the Romanian Socialist Union who is chairman of the Romanian Joint Preparatory Committee for Commemorating the Centenary of the Birth of President Kim Il Sung, praised the President as the great father and distinguished leader of the Korean people who devoted himself to the liberation of the country, the freedom and happiness of its people, the world peace and security and the cause of global independence all his life.
					
					Yehia Zakaria Khairullah, chairman of the Egyptian Committee for the Study of the Juche Idea, and a reporter and speakers lauded the President as the most famous person who laid a solid foundation for accomplishing the cause of independence against imperialism.
					
					Jairo Gonzalez Trujillo, president of the Group for the Study of the Juche Idea "Kanggye" of Colombia, said that Kim Il Sung was born in a revolutionary and patriotic family, embarked upon the road of revolution with a great will for liberating Korea and founded the undying Juche idea.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung's Work Published in Pakistan
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung's Work Published in Pakistan
Pyongyang, April 1 (KCNA) -- President Kim Il Sung's work "Let Us Accomplish the Cause of Socialism and Communism under the Revolutionary Banner of Juche" was brought out in pamphlet by the Victorial Publishing House of Pakistan with due ceremony in the publishing house on March 26.
					The work published on September 8, 1988 deals with the idea that it is a historic mission of the DPRK government to build socialism and communism by modeling the whole society on the Juche idea.
					
					Also indicated in the work is the way of settling the issue of national reunification and a common task facing the world people at present.

articles.title: Belarusian Personage Lauds Greatness of Kim Il Sung
articles.content:
Belarusian Personage Lauds Greatness of Kim Il Sung
Pyongyang, April 1 (KCNA) -- L. Shukolinikov, general secretary of the Permanent Committee of the Belarus-DPRK National Friend Association Named after Kim Il Sung, released a statement titled "Comrade Kim Il Sung and world" on March 24 to mark the Day of the Sun.
					The statement dealt with the ideological and theoretical exploits of President Kim Il Sung who founded the immortal Juche idea and the validity of the Juche idea.
					
					It continued:
					
					The Korean people are now struggling to build a thriving socialist nation and hasten the independent and peaceful reunification of the country on the basis of the Juche idea which was founded by the President and developed and enriched by leader Kim Jong Il.
					
					But for the politics of the Workers' Party of Korea led by Kim Il Sung, there would not have been the Pyongyang declaration admired by the whole world. 
					
					The Songun politics is a political mode that proceeded from the peculiarities of the DPRK and an essential factor for the victory of socialism.
					
					The DPRK leading the struggle against imperialism at present serves as a centre of all forces opposing imperialism.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Work Published in Kyrgyzstan
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Work Published in Kyrgyzstan
Pyongyang, April 1 (KCNA) -- Leader Kim Jong Il's Work "Let Us Carry Out the Great Leader Comrade Kim Il Sung's Instructions for National Reunification" was brought out in booklet on March 23 by the Yvsh-Ata Publishing House of Kyrgyzstan.
					The work published on August 4, 1997 deals with undying feats performed by President Kim Il Sung for the cause of national reunification.
					
					In the work the three principles of national reunification, 10-point programme of the great unity of the whole nation and the proposal for founding the Democratic Federal Republic of Koryo are formulated as the three charters for national reunification and tasks and ways to achieve national reunification based on them are indicated.

articles.title: Tower of the Juche Idea Introduced in Bangladesh
articles.content:
Tower of the Juche Idea Introduced in Bangladesh
Pyongyang, April 1 (KCNA) -- The Bangladesh Institute of the Juche Idea issued bulletin "The Tower of the Juche Idea" on Mar. 26 to commemorate the centenary of the birth of President Kim Il Sung.
					The bulletin said:
					
					When you go to Pyongyang, the capital of the DPRK, you may watch a torch that seems to be ablaze on the top of the tower standing on the banks of the Taedong River.
					
					That is the torch of the Tower of the Juche Idea, the highest stone tower in the world.
					
					The tower was unveiled in April 1982 to symbolize the greatness and immortality of the Juche idea founded by Kim Il Sung, the founder of socialist Korea, to mark the 70th anniversary of his birth.
					
					The groups of subsidiary sculptures on both sides of the tower depict the achievements made by Korean people upholding the banner of the Juche idea under the leadership of the President.
					
					The tower is visited by many Koreans and foreigners.

articles.title: Cause of Building of Thriving Nation in DPRK Supported
articles.content:
Cause of Building of Thriving Nation in DPRK Supported
Pyongyang, April 1 (KCNA) -- The 16th seminar of world political parties on building a new society was held in Mexico City between March 22 and 24.
					Delegates of various political parties and organizations highly praised the service personnel and people of the DPRK for firmly protecting the dignity and sovereignty of the nation and socialism, foiling every vicious provocation of the U.S. imperialists and the Lee Myung Bak regime of south Korea, united close around the dear respected Kim Jong Un.
					
					They expressed solidarity with the Korean people in their struggle to build a thriving socialist country and achieve the independent and peaceful reunification of the country under the uplifted banner of Songun.
					
					A joint statement was adopted at the seminar to support the just cause of the Korean people.
					
					The statement supported the Korean people's efforts to launch a working satellite manufactured by their own efforts and with indigenous technology to mark the centenary of the birth of President Kim Il Sung. 
					
					It also urged the imperialists to immediately stop their military provocations and saber-rattling against the DPRK and demanded that the Armistice Agreement be replaced by a peace treaty for ensuring lasting peace and stability on the Korean Peninsula.
					
					It expressed expectation that the Workers' Party of Korea, Songun cause of the Korean people and the cause of building a thriving socialist country would surely triumph.
					
					The coordinator of the National Coordinating Committee of the Workers' Party of Mexico (party leader) sent a letter to the dear respected Kim Jong Un in connection with the successful seminar.

articles.title: WPK and Korean People's Struggle Praised by Mexican Political Party Leaders
articles.content:
WPK and Korean People's Struggle Praised by Mexican Political Party Leaders
Pyongyang, April 1 (KCNA) -- Political party leaders of Mexico on March 23 separately met with a delegation of the Workers' Party of Korea led by An Kun Song, DPRK ambassador to Mexico, who participated in the 16th Seminar of World Political Parties on Building a New Society.
					Alberto Anaya Gutierrez, coordinator of the National Coordinating Committee of the Workers' Party of Mexico, hoped that the dear respected Kim Jong Un would successfully inherit and accomplish the revolutionary cause of Juche pioneered by President Kim Il Sung and energetically led by Kim Jong Il and continue developing the party, state and army of the DPRK.
					
					The coordinator said his party would make positive efforts to continue boosting the relations with the WPK and boost the exchange and cooperation with it.
					
					Jesus Antonio Carlos Hernandez, general secretary of the Central Committee of the People's Socialist Party of Mexico, noted that his party highly estimated the struggle of the WPK and the Korean people who are defending the socialist cause and instilling conviction and courage into the world peace-loving people despite the constant moves of the imperialists for aggression and their military threat.
					
					He expressed belief that the Korean people would register shining successes in building a thriving socialist nation and accomplishing the cause of national reunification under the wise leadership of Kim Jong Un.

articles.title: Lee Myung Bak Regime's Crackdown on Media under Fire
articles.content:
Lee Myung Bak Regime's Crackdown on Media under Fire
Pyongyang, April 1 (KCNA) -- Civic and public elders in south Korea held a press conference on Mar. 29 supporting the strike of media trade unions. 
					A press release read out there noted that trade unions of KBS, MBC, Yonhap News and other major media launched strikes for an indefinite period all at once because the Lee Myung Bak regime has resorted to an indiscriminate control of media and crackdown upon them during its office.
					
					It accused Lee Myung Bak of having worked hard to put media under control as evidenced by his acts of persecuting progressive media persons and appointing his confidants as managers of major media organizations.
					
					It is natural and just for the media trade unions to have turned out in protests to win the freedom of media, the press release said, expressing the will to join all the people in unequivocally supporting their strike.
					
					The media trade unions will surely emerge victorious in their strike, it concluded.

articles.title: Chinese FM Condemns Japan's Distortion of Textbooks
articles.content:
China Condemns Japan's Distortion of Textbooks
Pyongyang, April 1 (KCNA) -- Chinese Foreign Ministry spokesman Hong Lei in a press conference on March 29 censured Japan's textbook distortion.
					The results of an examination of Japanese textbooks made public on March 27 made it clear that Diaoyu island is marked as Japan's "inviolable territory" in all geography textbooks, he noted, and continued: Diaoyu island and islets attached to it are part of the inviolable territory of China  from the olden times.
					
					Any attempt to falsify this fact will prove to be futile, he held. 
					
					Recalling that many history textbooks of Japan deny the Nanjing massacre, he said the Nanjing massacre has clear evidence as it was a monstrous crime perpetrated by the Japanese militarists during its invasion of China.
					
					He urged Japan to properly deal with the historical matter and reasonably handle it.

articles.title: China Rejects Criticism over Its Budget for Defense and Cyberattack
articles.content:
China Rejects Criticism over Its Defense Budget
Pyongyang, April 1 (KCNA) -- A spokesperson for press of the Chinese Ministry of National Defense at a press conference on Mar. 29 rejected the criticism of his country over the defense budget and cyberattack.
					Accusing some media of finding fault with China's budget for defense, the spokesperson said China hopes all parties concerned will take professional and responsible attitude in assessing its defense budget.
					
					The increase in the budget for Chinese national defense is a normal requirement for ensuring the security of the country and conforms with the level of economic and social development, the spokesperson noted.
					
					Pointing to cyberattack, the spokesperson said China is its victim but has never chided other countries under this pretext.
					
					It is the view of China that such criticism only increases mutual skepticism and is not helpful to settling relevant issues.

articles.title: Bolivia Checks Weaponry Delivery of U.S. Embassy
articles.content:
Bolivia Checks Weaponry Delivery of U.S. Embassy
Pyongyang, April 1 (KCNA) -- The government of Bolivia recently supervised and checked arms delivery made by the U.S. embassy in its country.
					The minister of Interior said on Mar. 27 that his country seized weapons and 2 300 bullets delivered by vehicles of the U.S. embassy.
					
					The case poses threats to the security of the country, he added.

articles.title: BRICS to Play Constructive Role in World Economic Growth
articles.content:
BRICS to Play Constructive Role in World Economic Growth
Pyongyang, April 1 (KCNA) -- BRICS held its fourth summit in New Delhi on March 29.
					The summit discussed win-win cooperation, reform of international financial institutions, improvement of international economic management and world peace and security, etc.
					
					A communique adopted at the summit said that BRICS countries are playing a pivotal role in world economic recovery thanks to such collective efforts as boosting of cooperation and economic relations despite cultural and geographical barriers. This made it possible for those countries to play a role as a driving force for world economic growth and occupy a leading position in the changing world structure, it noted.
					
					The summit delivered a message of hope to the world that the world economy will eventually make steady headway by common efforts of the developing countries centered by BRICS, foreign press reports said.
					
					The agreements signed adopted at the summits positively promoted cooperation and economic development among BRICS member countries and raised their role in the international arena.
					
					The five-nation BRICS is leading the world economic growth coping with financial crisis.
					
					According to a survey, BRICS's quota in the world economic growth takes 56 percent whereas Western countries' barely takes 9 percent.
					
					Hence, the participants of this summit unanimously stressed the need for reforms of international financial institutions and called for establishing a new development bank with south-south cooperation as its key mission as a measure against the World Bank.
					
					Analysts say as BRICS will play an increasing role as a major force protecting the interests of the developing countries, the world structure will change to give spurs to multi-polarization.

articles.title: Fidel Castro Calls for Working for Peace and Justice
articles.content:
Fidel Castro Calls for Working for Peace and Justice
Havana, March 31 (KCNA) -- Fidel Castro Ruz, leader of the Cuban revolution, in his recent reflection called upon the international community to work for peace and justice to keep humankind alive irrespective of political view and religion.
					The number of people  who are left without shelter and suffering from acute shortage of food and water, denied healthcare and  opportunity of learning and jobs is daily increasing whereas wealth on the earth is being wasted through weapon production and ceaseless wars, he noted.
					
					Saying the Cuban people have never yielded to more than 50 years of U.S. blockade, he stressed: "Cuba has fought against the empire in the past and will do so in the future. This is our small feat and a modest contribution."

articles.title: Religious leader of Pakistan Strongly Condemns Presence of Foreign Troops in Afghanistan
articles.content:
Religious leader of Pakistan Strongly Condemns Presence of Foreign Troops in Afghanistan
Pyongyang, April 1 (KCNA) -- A Pakistani religious leader on March 28 condemned in the strongest words the presence of foreign troops in Afghanistan, adding that U.S. must leave the country immediately. 
					The chief of Tahreek Nizhat-e-Jaferia Pakistan, Allama Syed Sajid Ali Naqvi, said in a press interview that the presence of foreign troops in Afghanistan or in any part of the world is against all international norms and laws, affects the sovereignty of countries and disturbs world peace.
					
					The presence of U.S. in Afghanistan is unwarranted and illogical, he said, adding, "U.S. is nobody to interfere in our regional issues."

articles.title: Azerbaijan Denies Granting Israel Access to Air Bases
articles.content:
Azerbaijan Denies Granting Israel Access to Air Bases
Pyongyang, April 1 (KCNA) -- Azerbaijan's Defense Ministry Thursday denied claims in a U.S. magazine report that it granted Israel access to air bases on the border it shares with Iran, in the event of a future attack on Iran.
					"This information is absurd and groundless," ministry spokesman Teymur Abdullayev was quoted by media as saying.
					
					Ali Hasanov, a senior official at Azerbaijan's presidential administration, said Thursday such speculation was "aimed at damaging relations between Azerbaijan and Iran." 
					
					Azerbaijan's territory will never be used for any actions against Iran, he noted.

articles.title: Anti-Israel Actions in Jordan
articles.content:
Anti-Israel Actions in Jordan
Pyongyang, April 1 (KCNA) -- Dozens of Jordanians, including young groups and activists, on March 29 held a sit-in near the Israeli embassy, where they called for expelling the Israeli ambassador from Amman.
					The demonstrators called for the closure of the Israeli embassy in Amman, burning Israeli and U.S. flags.
					
					They called for resisting the Israeli occupation and voiced support for the Palestinians' struggle.

articles.title: Cooperation among Countries
articles.content:
Cooperation among Countries
Pyongyang, April 1 (KCNA) -- Cambodia and Vietnam on Wednesday signed a Memorandum of Understanding on cooperating in preventing illegal circulation of money.
					Cambodia and Thailand agreed to boost the relations and cooperation between the armies of the two countries on the same day.
					
					Singapore and Armenia on Wednesday signed an agreement on cultural cooperation aimed at fostering greater inter-cultural understanding between the two countries.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un firma cartas de funcionarios, trabajadores y alumnos
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un firma cartas de funcionarios, trabajadores y alumnos
Pyongyang, 1 de abril (ACNC) -- El Maximo Dirigente Kim Jong Un firmo el 28 de marzo las cartas que le dirigieran los funcionarios y trabajadores de varias unidades y ninos escolares.
					Entre los remitentes figuran los empleados del Complejo de Cemento de Sangwon y la Casa de Maternidad de Pyongyang, periodistas y redactores de la Editorial Literatura y Arte, las primeras oficiales de la Compania Kamnamu, participantes en la ceremonia inaugural del Restaurante Sinhung reconstruido y ampliado y primeros premiados del Premio de Honor Infantil Kim Jong Il de la provincia de Hamgyong del Norte.
					
					Los remitentes expresan su ferviente anoranza,  infinito respeto y veneracion hacia el Presidente       Kim Il Sung y el Dirigente Kim Jong Il en visperas del Dia del Sol.
					
					Le informaron sus ardientes anhelos de quedar fieles al Maximo Dirigente.
					
					Y le desean de todo corazon buena salud al Maximo Dirigente para la prosperidad de la nacion de Kim Il Sung y Corea de Kim Jong Il y la felicidad de todas las generaciones venideras.

articles.title: Sesionadas reuniones de delegados de provincias y ciudad del PTC
articles.content:
Sesionadas reuniones de delegados de provincias y ciudad del PTC
Pyongyang, 1 de abril (ACNC) -- Tuvieron lugar las reuniones de delegados de las provincias de Jagang, de Hwanghae del Sur, de Phyong-an del Norte y de Kangwon y la ciudad de Rason para elegir a los delegados a la Conferencia del Partido del Trabajo de Corea.
					A las ocasiones asistieron los delegados elegidos en las organizaciones del partido en las ciudades y distritos de respectivas provincias y las del partido que cumplen la misma funcion y las otras del partido de las instituciones a nivel provincial.
					
					Los participantes guardaron un momento de silencio en memoria del Dirigente Kim Jong Il.
					
					Los foros discutieron el tema de la eleccion a los delegados a la Conferencia del PTC.
					
					Hubo discursos que propusieron al Maximo Dirigente del PTC y el pueblo Kim Jong Un como delegado a la Conferencia del PTC.
					
					Los oradores dijeron que el Dirigente Kim Jong Il defendio la patria socialista y ofrecio al pueblo coreano el cimiento de vida feliz abriendo pasos en la delantera en el arduo camino  inexplorado con la volunta de acero y energia sobrehumana.
					
					Subrayaron que Kim Jong Un es el Maximo Dirigente del PTC y el pueblo quien conduce a la victoria la causa revolucionaria del Juche, la de construccion de un Estado prospero iniciada por el Presidente Kim Il Sung y conducida por el Dirigente y anadieron que gracias a sus dinamicas actividades ideo-teoricas y la probada direccion, se prepararon las guias ideo-teoricas que permiten llevar adelante la idea Juche, la del Songun y se adelanta la victoria de la causa revolucionaria del Juche y de la  construccion de Estado prospero.
					
					Elogiaron al Maximo Dirigente como gran politico quien con la sobresaliente cualidad, nobles rasgos y capacidad organizativa y con la destacada direccion dirige sabiamente la revolucion y la construccion  en su conjunto, y como general del monte Paektu quien hace lucir mas Corea como potencia militar.
					
					Los oradores propusieron cortesmente elegir al Maximo Dirigente como delegado a la Conferencia del PTC en reflejo de la voluntad unanime y deseo de todos los militantes del partido y habitantes de las citadas provincias y la ciudad.
					
					Apoyaron absolutamente tales propuestas.
					
					Los participantes las aprobaron por unanimidad.
					
					A continuacion, fueron electos otros delegados a la Conferencia del PTC.
